glsa.title: TikiWiki: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in TikiWiki, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: TikiWiki is an open source content management system written in PHP.

description.p: Stefan Esser reported that a previous vulnerability (CVE-2007-5423, GLSA 200710-21) was not properly fixed in TikiWiki 1.9.8.1 (CVE-2007-5682). The TikiWiki development team also added several checks to avoid file inclusion.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to inject arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All TikiWiki users should upgrade to the latest version:
